channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: The price of oil rose above $100 a barrel for the first time since 2014, European natural gas futures jumped 31%, and Asian stocks fell on Thursday as Russia invaded Ukraine, extending market turmoil that had been driven by fears of a full-scale attack. https://t.co/RJFcHym4O0

Ukraine’s ambassador to Ankara called on Turkey to close its airspace and to close the Bosporus and Dardanelles straits to warships. The straits are the only way that ships can reach the Mediterranean from the Black Sea, where Russia has a naval fleet. https://t.co/tJRi3rwmtO

President Biden plans to impose what he called "severe sanctions" against Russia on Thursday during a public address on the Russian invasion of Ukraine, as cities were attacked across the country.
"The world will hold Russia accountable," Biden said. https://t.co/93UiQYFhEH

These are some of the first images of Russian troops entering Ukraine, verified by The New York Times.
Footage captured by security cameras at a border crossing on Thursday morning shows Russian military vehicles entering from Crimea. https://t.co/iAaop3QWru https://t.co/U9gt81z6GR

Minutes after President Vladimir Putin of Russia announced a military operation in eastern Ukraine, explosions were visible near the city of Kharkiv. By early Thursday morning, several Ukrainian cities were under attack.
Follow updates on the invasion. https://t.co/DYJz87LmcM https://t.co/o2FQHYrqsu

Prime Minister Boris Johnson is abolishing Covid regulations to move to what he says is “back towards normality.” But vulnerable people say the move will constrict their lives instead. https://t.co/oY7WxwmWy7

“Russia has chosen war,” Prime Minister Scott Morrison of Australia said at a news conference, condemning the “brutal invasion” of Ukraine and denouncing Russia’s “unilateral hostile actions.” He promised to impose further economic sanctions. https://t.co/4t25uI68Ok

As Russia began its invasion of Ukraine, lines of cars moved out of the capital, Kyiv, many heading west and hoping to find safety in parts of the country closer to Poland and NATO troops.
Follow live updates. https://t.co/PAz9fDpKyG https://t.co/mvwKd3n4zw

President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine declared martial law in the country because of the Russian invasion.
Speaking in a TV address on Thursday morning, he did not clarify what restrictions would be in place. https://t.co/fGQ0BExS5r https://t.co/9SFvnle5GX

Kyiv residents huddled inside a metro station, which serves as a bomb shelter, after air raid sirens sounded early on Thursday morning.
Several cities in Ukraine were under attack as Russia began its invasion from land and sea. https://t.co/ktTIgEkZWl https://t.co/XVIoeR0YZK

Taiwan's foreign ministry has condemned Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. The self-governed island claimed by Beijing called the attack a violation of the UN charter.
Follow our live updates on Ukraine. https://t.co/BgiGFSpauV

Three men pleaded guilty on Wednesday in a plot to attack power grids in the U.S., which they believed could lead to economic and civil unrest and create the opportunity for white leaders to rise, federal prosecutors said. https://t.co/5RWroLGOEa

Ukraine’s foreign minister, Dmytro Kuleba, said on Twitter that President Vladimir Putin of Russia had “started a full-scale war against Ukraine” and had begun shelling several cities. “This is a war of aggression,” he wrote.
Follow our live updates. https://t.co/Ww20PBJzXO

President Biden said the world would “hold Russia accountable” after explosions were seen in Ukraine on Thursday.
“President Putin has chosen a premeditated war that will bring a catastrophic loss of life and human suffering,” Biden said in a statement. https://t.co/4XEGn05Bb1

Australia has joined the effort to punish Russia for its aggression in Ukraine, with targeted travel bans and financial sanctions that will be imposed on eight individuals on Russia’s national security council. https://t.co/oUisBeJmrO

Breaking News: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has begun, the Ukrainian interior ministry said. Explosions were reported in Kyiv and other parts of the country.
Follow our live updates. https://t.co/udwRoJIL0A

President Biden: “Russia alone is responsible for the death and destruction this attack will bring, and the United States and its allies and partners will respond in a united and decisive way. The world will hold Russia accountable.”
Follow live updates. https://t.co/3e6NQSGXMk
Breaking News: President Vladimir Putin announced he had made a decision to carry out a “special military operation” in eastern Ukraine. https://t.co/rXkUJPrhmt
Breaking News: Ukraine’s president made a dramatic televised speech, appealing directly to Russia to avoid war. “The Ukrainian people want peace,” he said. https://t.co/sGgJdlHFk0

Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa, a 16-year-old chess prodigy, defeated the reigning world champion, Magnus Carlsen, in an online chess competition from his home in India on Monday. While it didn't affect Carlsen's title, the defeat stunned the chess world. https://t.co/5TLpdbZiO4

Dr. Joseph Ladapo is expected to be confirmed soon as Florida’s new surgeon general. He is against mask mandates and lockdowns, only supports vaccination campaigns if the shots are voluntary and will not say whether he himself has been vaccinated. https://t.co/0p9psimhoZ

For the first time, U.S. regulators have officially authorized a condom to be used for anal sex, not just vaginal sex. The decision, announced by the FDA on Wednesday, has long been sought by sexual health experts. https://t.co/23HeGWOFwq https://t.co/LOw0KSN4pK
Breaking News: The prosecutors leading the Manhattan district attorney’s inquiry into Donald Trump have resigned. The D.A. is said to have doubts about the case. https://t.co/n6W30FopJw

A reading of “The Communist Manifesto” in Providence, Rhode Island, was interrupted on Monday when a group of people carrying a flag with a swastika banged on the windows and shouted slurs. https://t.co/gZTa63gxdx

A flight attendants’ union is pushing the Biden administration to extend the U.S. mask mandate for air travel, which is due to expire next month, until more people are vaccinated against the coronavirus. https://t.co/cfgnDFdmlX
Russia’s aggression in Ukraine has led to calls to move the Champions League final out of St. Petersburg, its scheduled host city. https://t.co/FlHbUtYccp

Breaking News: A new, two-dose Covid vaccine, made by the Europe-based pharmaceutical companies Sanofi and GSK, showed 100% efficacy against severe disease, and may be an effective booster for other shots, its makers said. https://t.co/dn37sIGYyT

In Opinion
President Vladimir Putin’s assertion that Ukraine was created by Russia was an attempt to establish a pretext for invasion, writes Madeleine Albright, a former U.S. secretary of state. “Should he do so, it will be a historic error.” https://t.co/ewMJNAmB8o

The European Union on Tuesday approved sanctions aimed at cutting off Russian individuals and entities from financial markets in response to Moscow's actions against Ukraine. https://t.co/J6EKUUgvRj https://t.co/qvwyVS2jy6

As President Biden announced sanctions against Russia, Donald Trump praised President Vladimir Putin’s aggression as “genius” and called the Russian leader “very savvy” for describing the troops aligned on the Ukrainian border as peacekeepers. https://t.co/u1pNadWI83

Russia’s decision to order troops into Ukraine presented the U.S. and Europe with the challenge of deciding how quickly to impose aggressive sanctions on Moscow. President Biden’s initial reaction was cautious, issuing a narrow set of sanctions. https://t.co/2ChmiJsRrc

Black farmers in the U.S. have yet to see any of $4 billion of aid that President Biden promised them in the stimulus package he signed nearly a year ago. The funds have been held up by lawsuits from white farmers alleging reverse discrimination. https://t.co/uHIncJntpm https://t.co/C7Ya7OG9WL

Ahmaud Arbery’s mother, Wanda Cooper-Jones, said it was “super Tuesday” after the jury found the three white men who murdered her son guilty of hate crimes. https://t.co/OE0bjtl5he https://t.co/C6FN1o6Q3V

About 99% of people in the U.S. and Europe see only a dim approximation of stars in the night sky because of light pollution. But not in Utah, which has the densest concentration of designated Dark Sky places in the world.
Take a look skyward. 🌌 https://t.co/2fiXsnbnPr https://t.co/iVFynFC1cY
Breaking News: Mark Lanegan, a singer for Screaming Trees and Queens of the Stone Age and an integral part of the 1980s and 1990s grunge scene, has died at 57. https://t.co/OJEfIBDFKS

Neil Cavuto returned to host Fox Business after more than a month, telling viewers that his absence was because of Covid-19 pneumonia that sent him to an intensive-care unit.
"Doctors say had I not been vaccinated at all, I wouldn’t be here," he said. https://t.co/JWSAFhSfVi

President Biden announced sanctions against Russia for what he called “the beginning of a Russian invasion of Ukraine." "Russia will pay an even steeper price if it continues its aggression, including additional sanctions," he said. https://t.co/ElQCRkqZ3p https://t.co/QfUSUjkqv8

Ju’Zema Goldring was walking in Atlanta with her friends when police officers arrested her for jaywalking and claimed there was cocaine inside her stress ball. They were wrong, a federal judge said. Now, after five months in jail, she's due $1.5 million. https://t.co/9FvCuSmPrB

U.S. senators from both parties have started working on legislation to provide emergency funds for Ukraine’s defense, sanction Russia’s economy and create a task force to seize the wealth of Russian oligarchs and possibly that of President Vladimir Putin. https://t.co/usWVVyvhAG
Breaking News: President Biden announced strong new sanctions aimed at punishing Russia for what he called “the beginning of a Russian invasion of Ukraine.” https://t.co/59zDRTZo4G

The new federal hate crimes convictions for the three white men who murdered Ahmaud Arbery ensure that they will receive significant prison time, even if their state convictions are overturned or their existing life sentences are reduced on appeal. https://t.co/g8SIaN2Opw https://t.co/gV9kQSJ3Lv
An average of 11.4 million viewers watched the Beijing Olympics on NBC Universal platforms each night — the smallest prime-time audience on record for any Winter Games. https://t.co/eDQGUvZQos

Breaking News: The three white men who murdered Ahmaud Arbery have been found guilty of hate crimes. Jurors determined that Travis McMichael, Gregory McMichael and William Bryan pursued and killed Arbery because he was Black. https://t.co/ACI7HX5n7B

For the three decades that Clarence Thomas has sat on the Supreme Court, he and Ginni Thomas have worked in tandem to take aim at targets like Roe v. Wade and affirmative action. Her views, once seen as fringe, have come to dominate the Republican Party. https://t.co/bcr9deqxR3

U.S. troops in Poland are setting up processing centers for tens of thousands of people, including U.S. citizens, who are expected to flee Ukraine if Russia invades the country, officials say. https://t.co/DqUp9Pbz69

As dawn broke in eastern Ukraine, some residents headed west, not waiting to see how Russia’s recognition of separatist regions might play out. One, Viktoria Gudyatskaya, got on a train with her daughter and a suitcase, unsure when she might return. https://t.co/z4y3wjS5zi
Breaking News: U.S. Soccer and a group of women’s players agreed to a $24 million settlement that included a pledge to equalize pay with the men’s team. https://t.co/BhsKHBpMXb

Breaking News: Germany halted the certification of Nord Stream 2, a key Russian natural gas pipeline, the West’s strongest move yet to punish Moscow for recognizing separatist regions in Ukraine. https://t.co/R5bfxeaOAQ

Russian troops entered the Donbas region of eastern Ukraine, the EU’s foreign policy chief said, although he stopped short of calling it an invasion.
“I wouldn’t say it is a fully fledged invasion,” he said, “but Russian troops are on Ukrainian soil.” https://t.co/EDGENHw0Az

Ukraine is “not afraid of anything,” President Volodymyr Zelensky said in a national address. He called for international support as President Vladimir Putin ordered Russian troops to two breakaway regions in Ukraine.
Read highlights from his speech. https://t.co/KgWA1165l3 https://t.co/qxvaXvdfCE
